info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 9:39PM EDT until March 31 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Pulaski County in southern Illinois... Massac County in southern Illinois... Central Pope County in southern Illinois... Northeastern Ballard County in western Kentucky... Northwestern McCracken County in western Kentucky... * Until 915 PM CDT. * At 839 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Karnak, or 10 miles northwest of Metropolis, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Metropolis, Karnak, Joppa and New Grand Chain. This includes Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 27 and 37. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southern Illinois...and western Kentucky. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for southern Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
